questions.prompt: April 15th is celebrated in baseball as Jackie Robinson Day because on that day, he:
answers: finished his service in the Army and was honorably discharged.
became the first African-American professional baseball player of the 20th century.
started the Brooklyn Dodgers baseball team.
had played for every baseball team in Major League Baseball.

questions.prompt: (Integrate and Interpret) What is the main purpose of this text?
answers: To describe the events leading to the passage of the 19th Amendment
To identify the states that first supported women’s voting rights
To discuss the most important leaders of the suffragist movement in the 1800s
To explain why the equal Rights Amendment has not been ratified

questions.prompt: (Integrate and Interpret) According to the text, why did Abigail Adams warn the Founding Fathers to “remember the ladies”? [adapted from NAEP asked Do you think the statements by Abigail Adams are an effective way to begin the article]
answers: She knew 1776 was an important time in US history.
She wanted a more equal government.
She warned that women would rebel and not follow laws made where women did not have a say.
She thought women were smart and could guide improve laws and government.

5th amendment

19th amendment

questions.prompt: * (Locate and Recall) About how many years did it take after the Declaration of Independence for women to earn the right to vote in every state?
answers: 10 years
50 years
100 years
150 years

questions.prompt: (Integrate and Interpret) In terms of women’s suffrage, what is a key difference between the Declaration of Independence and the 19th Amendment?
answers: One gave equal rights to men and the other gave voting rights to all.
One gave men voting rights and the other gave women voting rights.
One gave men equal rights and the other gave women equal rights.
One happened in history and the other happened recently.

questions.prompt: (Locate & Recall) According to the article, what was most surprising about the 'Womanifesto'?
answers: It was written by Elizabeth Cady Stanton.
It called for equal voting rights for men and women.
It was based on the Declaration of Independence.
It had such a large number of resolutions.

questions.prompt: (Integrate & Interpret) When Elizabeth Cady Stanton wrote the Womanifesto, why did she demand equal voting rights rather than other rights like property ownership?
answers: It was patterned on the Declaration of Independence which showed that universal suffrage was important.
She wanted to shock people and get more attention for the important cause
She realized that being able to vote meant that women could have a say in making laws that could get them more rights.
She thought it would encourage more individuals to join the Women’s suffrage movement.

questions.prompt: (Integrate and Interpret) The article says that women in the suffrage movement 'pressed their case state by state.' This means that the women:
answers: spoke with newspaper reporters in many states.
strongly urged the states to pass women's suffrage.
traveled in large groups together from state to state.
introduced the idea of women's suffrage to the states.

questions.prompt: (Integrate and Interpret) Why was the Wyoming Territory the first state or territory to give women the right to vote?
answers: Because the small number of women there would not have had much political influence
Because the suffragist movement was very active in the western United States
Because most politicians there chose not to vote on that resolution
Because it was important for women to have the vote in such a dangerous area

questions.prompt: (Integrate and Interpret) The following were factors that contributed to the women’s suffrage movement EXCEPT
answers: Women organized at the Women’s Rights Convention.
Women demonstrated and picketed.

questions.prompt: (Integrate and Interpret) The text states that 'In 1878, a constitutional amendment was introduced…in 1887, the Senate voted against it.' What can you infer from that information?
answers: The amendment established equal voting rights for all and support was mixed.
The amendment established equal rights for all and had strong support.
The amendment established equal voting rights for all, but had declining support.
The amendment established equal voting rights and had increasing support.

There are millions of mummies to learn from.
Mummies have been puzzles and these tools help them solve the puzzles.

questions.prompt: (Locate and Recall) Why did the Egyptians create mummies?
answers: To protect their loved ones after death
To leave clues for future generations about their life
To celebrate the lives of their loved ones
To help scientists and researchers

questions.prompt: (Integrate and Interpret) How is the Ancient Egyptian tradition of mummification related to their beliefs?
answers: The mummification process preserves one’s body for the afterlife.
The mummification process celebrates and honors the lives of loved ones.
The mummification process documents important information about Ancient Egyptian civilization.
The mummification process provides future generations with critical information that can be used to solve present problems.

questions.prompt: (Locate and Recall) According to the article, what did scientists in the past do to study mummies?
answers: They looked through microscopes.
They analyzed food remains.
They cut through the bodies.
They soaked the bodies in chemicals.

questions.prompt: (Locate and Recall) What do scientists do now to study mummies?
answers: Travel internationally
Use X-rays to model the mummies insides
Collaborate at academic conferences
Carbon date materials

took control illegally

questions.prompt: (Locate and Recall) How did scientists identify Hatshepsut's mummy?
answers: They used the results of DNA testing.
They found her family tomb.
They located her husband's remains.
They decoded the writing on her mummy case.

questions.prompt: (Integrate and Interpret) According to the text, Queen Hatshepsut 'stole the throne and declared herself a pharoah. She even dressed as a man.' What do you think the author included these details in the text?
answers: To show how rare it was for Queen Hatshepsut to be a pharoah, or Egyptian King
To show clues to look for in terms of identifying Queen Hatshepsut’s mummy
To show how DNA evidence might be helpful in identifying Queen Hatshepsut
To show that Queen Hatshepsut became Queen illegally

questions.prompt: (Locate & Recall) Scientists think the study of mummies could someday help to make sick people better. Which of the following explains why?
answers: Because the chemicals that Ancient Egyptians put on the mummies tell us about illnesses
Because mummies had ancient illnesses
The mummification process preserved medicines and cures that were used in Egyptian times.
Researchers learn what diseases infected ancient people to understand how diseases have changed over time.

questions.prompt: (Integrate and Interpret) According to the text, studying mummies teaches us about the past and present. Why do you think researchers focus on studying mummies versus other artifacts from other ancient civilizations?
answers: Ancient Egyptian civilization began 5,100 years ago, so mummies are particularly old artifacts.
The mummification process preserves the bodies from decomposing making it easier to study the mummies and the diseases the infected them.
Queen Hatshepsut was a particularly important figure and the first female ruler, making studying her mummy important.
The detailed coffins, or cases, show the sophisticated civilization that existed in Ancient Egypt and from which we can learn a lot.

questions.prompt: (Integrate and Interpret) Bob Brier says that 'mummies are crucial to medical science.' Brier means that:
answers: scientists are surprised about what mummies can teach them
research on mummies should be done only by doctors
scientists are worried that mummies may bring back old diseases
information about mummies is very important to doctors.

questions.prompt: (Integrate & Interpret) In the last paragraph, what does Bob Brier mean by the phrase 'to read' a mummy?
answers: To understand the words written on a mummy
To visit museum exhibitions about mummies
To gather information by examining a mummy
To make sense of the stories about mummies

questions.prompt: * (Integrate and Interpret) Which of the following sentences says why Hatshepsut is considered a powerful female ruler?
answers: Hatshepsut reigned more than 3,500 years ago- as queen and king.
She first served as queen until her husband died.
She stole the throne and declared herself a pharaoh.
She even dressed as a man.
